Aight, so the game is dead. nothing more to say. i found 2 players and I was surprised, and also. It still didn't let me Play with them. it said i had to wait my turn. it didn't come

This is it, ladies and gentleman... Valve's very worst game. There are plenty of their games that I don't like all that much, but this is a game that's so bad it just has zero people playing it. Ever. I can't believe that this is still being sold for £3.99, let alone the "mostly positive" review summary. Maybe it's meant in the way that people are mostly positive that Ricochet is a pile of donkey crap! 
It's a unique idea for sure. The maps have this bizarre fever dream atmosphere, like you're trapped in limbo jumping across these giant discs for eternity. It might've been fun twenty years ago. MIGHT HAVE. There's not even any bots to play with. But hey, at least you can... create your own server... and uh, pretend to play with people using your imagination. That's about as fun as Ricochet is. The best thing to come out of this game is the hilarious death animation when you fall into the void.
Why are you reading reviews for Ricochet? You weren't gonna buy it anyway.

Another abandoned Valve game in the same state as Deathmatch Classic . The game with simple and easy gameplay mechanics . I think that it can be really addictive . It is like another MOD for Counter-Strike . The playerbase is pretty much dead but if you have some friends, then  definitely try this game with them . Wait for the big sales and purchase it , because it is not worth it´s price .

Ricochet.

It is the strangest game from Valve Corporation. It is also one of the least known games developed by them. I played it for 10 minutes. It was completely empty. Is it truly dead? Not sure. Is it truly undead? Not sure either. Mysteries of Ricochet are hard to grasp. Be careful to not let Ricochet ricochet you to the Void. This game might be something that represents eternal struggle to survive. Or it is just one small completely insignificant particle of the universe. Ricochet is above and beyond answering what it is to anyone. Ricochet cannot be truly understood. You must simply accept that Ricochet exists. 

Let's give a one-minute silence to Ricochet. Even if it's neither dead nor undead (it can be both dead and undead). 

Ricochet.
Duygulanmak için birebir.

LITERALLY GOTC.
You literally cannot top this. CD PROJECT RED still can't defeat Valve just due to the existence of this masterpiece. If Titanfall keeps getting better every release, Titanfall XVII might come close to Ricochet. Zun, Martin O'Donnel and Hans Zimmer is creating the soundtrack for Ricochet 2 and Ricochet 2.5 so looking forward to it. Hopefully it releases before I die. Valve hasn't announced it yet, but Star Wars exists in the same universe as Ricochet. Everytime a player misses a shot, a terrible new Star wars movie gets released. Thankfully nobody plays this anymore except a few a few oldies ho lost their touch. This game is also referenced in the manga Yotsuba&! and Sakigake!! Cromartie Koukou. /k/ described the gunplay of the the weapon pickup system as sublime and /fit/ recommends playing this for maintaining peak performance. /b/ called this game racist so its probably good.

The Greatest game ever made.  
Scratch that, the greatest work of art ever.  Mona Lisa? Chicken scratches!  Beethoven's 9th? the slobbering of an infant!
Every other Valve game is just a feeble mockery of this pinnacle of video game.  
The smooth gameplay as you throw discs in flat lines, so immersive you lose yourself in the incredibly detailed maps.
The reflective scream your character makes as he falls towards the abyss, symbolic of our own primal fear of death.
The absence of music representing the absence of happiness in a world that has fallen into endless war.
That this game is not owned by every steam user is a tragedy that cannot be expressed by the combined efforts of every poet, author, painter, composer, playwright, hairsylist, tattoo artist, actor, floralist, singer, dancer, and chef that ever existed, exists, or will exist.

Buy this game. Change your life.

A Valve game everyone forgot about and for a good reason.

Let's see, for 5 dollars you get 3 uncreative maps, no playerbase (there was literally no-one playing the day I'm writing this), and no bots.

This game is basically just a HL1 mod of Tron's Light Discs, you have a disc as your only weapon.
Left-click throws the disc to knock off enemies off the map, and you can throw three of them before recharging.
Right-click throws the disc but this time it can decapitate the opponent's head, the catch is you can only throw one before recharging.
That's all the game is.

The game is outdated, the disc doesn't even have a viewmodel (You have to mod that) and aiming vertically is impossible.
Fortunately, if you want to play this so badly, there are servers with bots that only spawn if you join the server.

I say spend the extra 5 dollars to get Tron 2.0, which is very similar but infinitely better.
But again, chances are you probably got this game from a bundle or to just add it to your collection.

Ricochet 2 anybody?

Possibly the greatest game of all time. Truly a misunderstood masterpiece that will surely be written into the history books as a revolutionary, innovative, ingenious, and above all else, utterly enjoyable experience. At the time of this review, the game's community can best be described as 'dead.' And although the servers are seldom filled with even a single player or bot, I shall forever be awaiting the day this franchise makes its ceremonious return into the spotlight as the bastion of gaming it deserves to be. I can only pray that this day comes within my lifetime - and even if it doesn't - that future generations have the capacity to appreciate it to the furthest extent possible. Alas, I must confess, this game may never receive its well-deserved second wind, and if that truly is the case, then perhaps humanity never deserved a game such as Ricochet in the first place.

Popular user-defined tags for this product:
Action, FPS, Multiplayer, Masterpiece, Classic.
I mean man, you gotta agree. In my 6 glorious minutes of gameplay, I was helplessly jumping off platforms into the abyss as if the servers weren't dead enough, dude, that got the adrenaline pumping through my veins. And the gun play was beautiful, you had the disc, you threw the disc, and you lost the disc, and you killed yourself, I really felt immersed in the game when I was dropping discs like it just turned Thursday. Next, the multiplayer, I mean, my guy, back in my day all the cool kids were talking about Ricochet, when I got home, I invited all 5 of my burner accounts to play Ricochet, it was a real bonding experience. This classic will always have a place in my kidneys.

Needs a remaster badly. Ricochet is the forgotten candy from the Halloween bag of everyone's library who bought the Valve collection. A 20 year-old game that isn't entirely abandoned feature Tron-esque colorful platform that you ricochet off of to other platforms in hopes to toss a disc to your opponents, knocking them off or beheading them. It's a relic of the past that should be more remembered. and the fact that you can only toss a disc horizontally is a joke in my opinion.
Yes

Ricochet 2 when???

Before you read all of my review I must first state that I came into this game thinking it was a cheap 30-megabyte goldsrc mod and that I wouldn't think of it a minute after I stopped playing it. But I was dead wrong.

The game ricochet is a grand masterpiece with the likes of the original Half-Life and Half-Life 2. My dream for this game is to see a source port be officially made by Valve one day, and have esports teams form around it.

When I first played Ricochet, I noticed that the player's control of jumping was removed. I later figured out that it was because on the jump pads at the edges of the platforms in the map were what moved the player vertically. In my opinion that is such a great game mechanic because it gives less worry to the player about dodging the projectiles from other players. There are games like Team Fortress 2 where you must try to dodge almost every single bullet, but with ricochet, I must add that it is impossible to aim vertically, but only horizontally. In a single server, there could be on each platform a different 1v1, where each player has to fight it out between each other, and no one else can interfere. The name of the game, "Ricochet", comes from another one of the game mechanics where the discs you throw can bounce off of walls. You can use this game mechanic to use with a little bit of skill like playing a game of pool to hit an enemy player across the map. I think that this game should have much more maps available from the developers themselves, and the community. I would also like to see a "Competitive" gamemode added to the game so that pros like myself could duel it out to see who is the best Ricochet player alive.

Неделю назад у меня была колбаса. Она была вкусная. Прошла неделя и она протухла. Я же не буду ее жрать, потому что раньше она была вкусной.
This game is really outdated.

This game saved my life.

I am 29.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game too many times, or play nearly as long as some of you. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you
this helped me overcome by long-lasting depression
